Articles.Content: Hi, how do I install it???
Like all mods. You unzip it in GameData.

> 
> 
> 7 hours ago, sarbian said:
> 
> 
> Like all mods. You unzip it in GameData.
> 

Thanks!

**EDIT:** This may have been caused by some other mod that conflicts with MFI. I don't think it's MFI itself. I'm going to figure out what mod that is and remove it. But until then, I'll keep this post here just to log what's going on.

FYI, I'm on 1.1.2 64bit KSP and this mod bugs my KSP, where my vessel would hover over the KSC runway and not move, when I launch it. And when I hit the first stage, it'll just fall over. This bug went away when I uninstalled this mod. (Notice the rear wheels)

![fG4EhWFl.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/fG4EhWFl.jpg)

**Edited <time datetime="2016-05-01T21:22:26Z" title="05/01/2016 09:22  PM" data-short="8 yr">May 1, 2016</time> by Tortoise**
FYI I'm on the KSP forums and this post just gives general complaints and then falls over when I hit pagedown. When I looked for logs I didn't find any, so I uninstalled the post.

And anyway since you sig is " proudly have never used mechjeb before." I am afraid I will have to proudly not help.

**Edited <time datetime="2016-05-01T20:21:43Z" title="05/01/2016 08:21  PM" data-short="8 yr">May 1, 2016</time> by sarbian**

> 
> 
> 7 minutes ago, sarbian said:
> 
> 
> And anyway since you sig is " proudly have never used mechjeb before." I am afraid I will have to proudly not help.
> 

If you are (for some reason) offended by my signature, it's nothing against your mod. Your probably one of the greatest mods developed for KSP. But I think it'd be a great achievement to have played KSP for a long time and have never used autopilot. That's why my signature is there. I'd prefer to keep it.

1.1.4 KSP 1.1.2

Download : [ModularFlightIntegrator-1.1.4.0.zip](https://ksp.sarbian.com/jenkins/job/ModularFlightIntegrator/15/artifact/ModularFlightIntegrator-1.1.4.0.zip)

So I may have a bug report for you [@sarbian](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/57146-sarbian/) (although it looks like you just released a new version, so that may fix it). It involves the planet pack [Other Worlds](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/115917-11105-kopernicus-other_worlds-starplanet-pack-v102/#comment-2063589) which adds a second Sun and surrounding planets to the game. While in Map View, I focused viewed every planet in the game, and every planet pertaining to that pack caused ModularFlightIntegrator to throw a wall of NRE's (see below, log [here](https://www.dropbox.com/s/gaa3sg49yuwwvdj/Player%20%28MFI%29.log?dl=0)). My guess is, as mentioned, it's the issue of the second Sun, and the NRE's disappear as soon as I switch back to a planet that orbits Sol.

If this report belongs in the Other Worlds thread instead of here, let me know and I'll scurry on over there instead.

This is on Linux x64 with v1.1.13 for KSP 1.1.12.

Cheers.

    NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object
      at FlightIntegrator.CalculateSunBodyFlux () [0x00000] in :0 
      at ModularFI.ModularFlightIntegrator.CalculateSunBodyFlux () [0x00000] in :0 
      at FlightIntegrator.ThermoPrecalculate () [0x00000] in :0 
      at FlightIntegrator.Update () [0x00000] in :0

It involves the planet pack [Other Worlds](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/115917-11105-kopernicus-other_worlds-starplanet-pack-v102/#comment-2063589) which adds a second Sun and surrounding planets to the game. While in Map View, I focused viewed every planet in the game, and every planet pertaining to that pack caused ModularFlightIntegrator to throw a wall of NRE's (see below, log [here](https://www.dropbox.com/s/gaa3sg49yuwwvdj/Player%20%28MFI%29.log?dl=0)). My guess is, as mentioned, it's the issue of the second Sun, and the NRE's disappear as soon as I switch back to a planet that orbits Sol.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> If this report belongs in the Other Worlds thread instead of here, let me know and I'll scurry on over there instead.
> 

Since the call generating the error is in stock I have a strong feeling the problem is not related to MFI.

> 
> 
> 5 hours ago, sarbian said:
> 
> 
> Since the call generating the error is in stock I have a strong feeling the problem is not related to MFI.
> 

Thank you for taking the time to respond. Figured I'd mention it anyway.

Cheers.

1.1.5 Include a fix by [@Thomas P.](%7B___base_url___%7D/index.php?/profile/113164-thomas-p/) for the calculateSunBodyFLux delegate check

Download : [ModularFlightIntegrator-1.1.5.0.zip](https://ksp.sarbian.com/jenkins/job/ModularFlightIntegrator/lastSuccessfulBuild/artifact/ModularFlightIntegrator-1.1.5.0.zip)

Source : [https://github.com/sarbian/ModularFlightIntegrator](https://github.com/sarbian/ModularFlightIntegrator)

Getting spammed with this error in the log:

NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object  

    ModularFI.ModularFlightIntegrator.CalculateSunBodyFlux ()  

    FlightIntegrator.ThermoPrecalculate ()  

    FlightIntegrator.Update ()

What version of MFI do you have installed?... Would it by chance be something OTHER than version 1.1.5.0? If you do NOT have v 1.1.5.0, perhaps it might help if you read the post right above yours?  

Also have you noticed this in sarbian's signature?

---->  No [logs](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/92229#Logs) => No support

> 
> 
> What version of MFI do you have installed?... Would it by chance be something OTHER than version 1.1.5.0? If you do NOT have v 1.1.5.0, perhaps it might help if you read the post right above yours?

Looks like the issue was that <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">ckan</abbr> only updates to 1.1.3.0. I had to manually update to 1.1.5.0 through the command line.

It's almost a daily visit ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif ":P")

**Edited <time datetime="2016-06-25T19:07:07Z" title="06/25/2016 07:07  PM" data-short="8 yr">June 25, 2016</time> by TheKurgan**

[@sarbian](%7B___base_url___%7D/index.php?/profile/57146-sarbian/):  Any idea which mods use this?  I'm having overheat-on-physics-load explosions from drills and ISRUs, and the logs implicate FlightIntegrator.

Then I looked in my Gamedatta folder and lo and behold, I find this mod in there, although I never knew of its existence until just now.  I didn't download it myself and I can't find it as part of some other mod, so I'm rather curious as to how I ended up with it and whether it's the root cause of my overheating problems.

Logs of the overheating issue:    [https://www.dropbox.com/s/yxs5cnxsixxrpmk/Pathfinder Overheating.zip?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/yxs5cnxsixxrpmk/Pathfinder%20Overheating.zip?dl=0)

Thanks.
